description: Conversion of existing house to form 6 self-contained flats; rear ground and first floor level extensions; external alterations.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with Council's Adopted UDP ' New Plan for the Environment' policies 4.1 and 5.9. | Details of refuse storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with Council's Adopted UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local  Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by theLocal Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' Policies 4.1, 4.5. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected and this shall ensure visibility splays of 1.5m by 1.5m and there are no obstructions to visibility above 0.6m high at the vehicular access point.  The details as approved shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and permanently retained.  REASON:	To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with Council's Adopted 'New Plan for the Environment' UDP policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5. | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' Policies 4.1, 5.5. | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide 4 covered and secure cycle parking spaces in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  REASON:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' Policies 5.5, 9.1 and 9.6 . | Notwithstanding the parking layout shown on approved plan 2235-25 dated 15/11/04, details of parking, pedestrian access and landscaping to the front of the property in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works commence on site.  Such provision to be brought into use prior to the first occupation of any part of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking and pedestrians within the site and to protect the visual appearance of the area in accordance with Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' Policies 4.1, 4.6 and 9.1. | Details shall be submitted and approved by the local planning authority, before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that a composite sound reduction index of not less than 34dB for bedrooms and not less than 29dB for living rooms shall be achieved for the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided.  The details shall also include the provision of ventilator units in each room in accordance with Council criteria.  The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and permanently retained  thereafter.  REASON:	The new dwelling will be affected by aircraft noise from Heathrow airport at a level of worst mode one day equal to LAeq,16hr 57dB and worst mode one hour LAeq,1hr 64dB.  This will bring the dwelling within Category B of PPG 24 guidance, and the condition will protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' policies 4.1 and 4.11. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of gates and fences to be erected.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  REASON:	To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with Council's Adopted UDP 'New Plan for the Environment' Policies 4.1 and 4.4.
